column5: when in Dryden, i always go to the PI (patricia inn) for their burgers. get a good portion and never have left feeling empty.

Been a number of years,but we always stopped at the Patricia Inn for dinner before the last push up to Sioux Lookout. Meals were good with hearty portions. I'd probably stop there again for old times sake. PjShorthorn
Between international falls and red lake? Recommendation? ?

"descent"......a moral, social, or psychological decline into a specified undesirable state: "the ancient empire's slow descent into barbarism" There's a lot of that going on these days. Probably even the burgers too.........

Restaurant at Howey Bay Motel in Red Lake serves a great burger on their lunch menu. No need to tell them how you want it cooked because it's going to be well done. Seems that's the way it's done in Canada. Seems like a good idea to me. No rare ground beef for me.
Might want to grab a fish sandwich just in case. Not predicting, just saying.
Try the Whisky Jack just south of Perrault Falls on 105. Good pizza, great fries and friendly owners.

Thanks all..., Big John....Mineshaft Grill and Tavern...Nestor Falls????...worked out pretty good.. Wife was happy with the burger...I had Curry Thai chicken which was unexpectedly true to it's name....and tasty..
Kokums Bannock Shack or the PI right next door to it here in Dryden. Only problem with kokums...bannock and gravy...definately artery clogging greatness.
Can't beat a Big Mac from McDonalds
Most any place is better than McDonalds for burgers.
Think you should re-phrase that: ANY PLACE, IS better than McDonalds. But it may help with any Constipation one may have. Sent from my XT1254 using Tapatalk
